history.p: It was not until the beginning of 1910 that Nielsen started to consider writing a third symphony. The first movement was finished on 13 April; then the symphony was put aside for a while so that he could concentrate on the music for the play Hagbarth og Signe (CNW 12), which was to be finished for a performance in June. In July, Nielsen continued working on the symphony, but was forced to stop because of a depression. It was finished in the autumn and winter of 1910–11 under very difficult circumstances because of Nielsen's duties at The Royal Theatre.

event.desc: Vilhelm Herold performed at the same concert but it is not clear whether he sang a part in the symphony.

history.p: The piano version seems to have been planned for publication at C.F. Kahnt in Leipzig, since the publisher advertised it in a catalogue in 1913. However, it was apparently never published.

relation.label: Arrangements not by Nielsen: See Appendix

ptr.label: Description from Carl Nielsen Studies II (2005)

annot.p: Contains three fragments of the first movement (bb. 1–74, 1–68, and 1–14) in three different arrangements by Henrik Knudsen, the last of which is identical to Nielsen's arrangement.

physDesc.physMedium: Contains bb.1–252 (parte prima) and 1–290 (parte seconda) of the first movement only.
